required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison With Open and Totally Laparoscopic Gastrectomy for Gastric Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison With Open and Totally Laparoscopic Gastrectomy for Gastric Cancer in a Low Volume Center

lead_sponsor.agency: Kocaeli Derince Education and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kocaeli Derince Education and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: In gastric cancer, laparoscopic gastrectomy is commonly performed in Asian countries. In other regions where tumor incidence is relatively low and patient characteristics are different, developments in this issue have been limited. In this study, the investigators aimed to compare the early results for patients who underwent open or laparoscopic gastrectomy for gastric cancer in a center in Turkey.

detailed_description.textblock: The patients who were operated in Kocaeli Derince Training and Research Hospital between January 2014 and January 2019 consecutively due to gastric cancer were analyzed. The diagnosis was made by upper gastrointestinal endoscopy and endoscopic biopsy. Clinical staging was done using contrast computed tomography (CT). Positron emission tomography (PET) was used in patients with suspected metastasis.The patients were divided into two groups according to the technique applied (open, laparotomy). The first group (Group 1; n: 30) consisted of patients who underwent open surgery, and the second group (Group 2, n: 30) laparoscopic surgery.

primary_outcome.description: 1,2,3 A,3 B,4 A,4 B,5 (according to Clavien-Dindo Classification)

primary_outcome.measure: Tumor stage (American Joint Committee on Cancer 8th Edition)
primary_outcome.description: 0,1,2 A,2 B,3,4 A, 4 B (According to American Joint Committee on Cancer 8th Edition)

arm_group.description: The first group (Group 1; n: 30) consisted of patients who underwent open surgery
The second group (group 2; n:30) consisted of patients who underwent laparoscopic gastrectomy

intervention.description: gastric resection with lymph node dissection(D1+,D2) for stomach cancer.

study_pop.textblock: The patients who were operated in Kocaeli Derince Training and Research Hospital between January 2014 and January 2019 consecutively due to gastric cancer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Gastric cancer(adenocarcinoma) proven biopsy
- Operated by same surgical team
- Presence of distant metastasis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who underwent palliative resection
- operated by a different surgical team
- ASA score: 4

facility.name: Kocaeli Derince Training and research Hospital

Feasibility of Laparoscopic Radical Gastrectomy for Gastric Cancer of Clinical Stage II or Higher: Early Outcomes in a Phase II Study (KUGC04). Ann Surg Oncol. 2016 Aug;23(Suppl 4):516-523. Epub 2016 Jul 11.

A systematic review of the literature. Gastric Cancer. 2018 Jan;21(1):19-30. doi: 10.1007/s10120-017-0747-0. Epub 2017 Jul 20. Review.

Haverkamp L, Ruurda JP, Offerhaus GJ, Weijs TJ, van der Sluis PC, van Hillegersberg R. Laparoscopic gastrectomy in Western European patients with advanced gastric cancer. Eur J Surg Oncol. 2016 Jan;42(1):110-5. doi: 10.1016/j.ejso.2015.09.018. Epub 2015 Oct 22.

responsible_party.investigator_title: M.D. Department of Gastroenterological surgery,Principal Investigator
